trans-unit.source: Quick maps
Add a GoogleMap, MapBox or OpenStreetMap to the current page in a quick and simple way
Street
zip
city
latitude
longitude
country
map
fetch coordinates from address
description of map and position
open map description on startup
location
display properties
map width, in pixel (only visible to the frontend view!)
map height, in pixel (only visible to the frontend view!)
map type (only GoogleMaps and MapBox)
GoogleMaps: roadmap
GoogleMaps: terrain
GoogleMaps: hybrid
GoogleMaps: satellite
MapBox: default simple
MapBox: streets
MapBox: bright
MapBox: light
MapBox: dark
MapBox: satellite
card zoom level
navigation controls (only GoogleMaps)
GoogleMaps: default
GoogleMaps: small controls
GoogleMaps: bigger controls
GoogleMaps: small controls (used in Android)
Map provider
Google maps
OpenStreetMap
MapBox
Map settings
Map Provider: Select desired map provider to be used for map drawing (GoogleMaps and MapBox requires a key)
OpenStreetMap JS library: Set URL to openstreetmap javascript library
OpenStreetMap Styles: Set URL to openstreetmap stylessheet
Tile layer template: Set template string to the tile layer
Tile layer attribution: Set attribution string to the tile layer
OpenStreetMap icon: Set URL to openstreetmap icon (f.e. fileadmin/images/osmMarker.png)
OpenStreetMap icon width: Set icon width in pixel
OpenStreetMap icon height: Set icon height in pixel
OpenStreetMap icon anchor X: Horizontal position (x) for marker pixel in icon (in pixel)
OpenStreetMap icon anchor Y: Vertical position (y) for marker pixel in icon (in pixel)
OpenStreetMap popup anchor X: Horizontal position (x) for popup arrow position (in pixel)
OpenStreetMap popup anchor Y: Vertical position (y) for popup arrow position (in pixel)
OpenStreetMap tooltip anchor X: Horizontal position (x) for tooltip in pixel relative to the icon
OpenStreetMap tooltip anchor Y: Vertical position (y) for tooltip in pixel relative to the icon
OpenStreetMap shadow url: Set URL to openstreetmap icon shadow (f.e. fileadmin/images/osmMarkerShadow.png)
OpenStreetMap shadow width: Set icon shadow width in pixel
OpenStreetMap shadow height: Set icon shadow width in pixel
OpenStreetMap shadow anchor X: Horizontal position (x) for marker pixel in icon shadow
OpenStreetMap shadow anchor Y: Vertical position (y) for marker pixel in icon shadow
MapBox JS library: Set URL to mapbox javascript library
MapBox Styles: Set URL to mapbox stylessheet
MapBox access token: Set access token of mapbox, see: https://www.mapbox.com/account/access-tokens to request a token
MapBox icon: Set URL to MapBox icon (f.e. fileadmin/images/osmMarker.png)
MapBox icon width: Set icon width in pixel
MapBox icon height: Set icon height in pixel
MapBox icon offset x: Set icon horizontal offset in pixel
MapBox icon offset y: Set icon vertical offset in pixel
GoogleMaps JS library: Set URL to googlemaps javascript library
GoogleMaps api key: Set googlemaps api key see: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/ to request an api key
Activte zooming by mousewheel: Use scrollwheel for zooming in maps?
Default latitude: Set latitude as float value, if you would like to set some default coordinates
Default longitude: Set longitude as float value, if you would like to set some default coordinates
Default info text: Set info text to be shown in the text box to the pin as default
Open info text box: Should info text box be opened at start?
Default map width: Set default width of map (in pixel), if empty 100% width will be used and map will be resonsive
Default map height: Set default height of map (in pixel)
Default zoom level: Set default map zoom level (default = 15)
Default map type: Set default map type
Default map controls: Select map controls which should be shown in the map
Map icon: Alternate map icon (only GoogleMaps): path: relative to document root (e.g. "fileadmin/images/googlePin.png"), the targeting point resides to the center bottom of the graphic file.
Alternate map styling (only GoogleMaps): path: relative to document root (e.g. "fileadmin/images/googleStyles.txt").
